Claim: An explosion that occurred in Wuhan, China, is tied to the coronavirus outbreak.
Explaination: It was a video supposedly of an explosion in Wuhan, China. A search showed it was actually footage of the first of several explosions in Tianjin, China, from 2015.
Label: False
html:
Claim: An explosion that occurred in Wuhan, China, is tied to the coronavirus outbreak.

Explanation:It was a video supposedly of an explosion in Wuhan, China. A search showed it was actually footage of the first of several explosions in Tianjin, China, from 2015.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471546-fake-news-no-large-explosion-in-wuhan-china-tied-to-coronavirus-outbreak.html
ann23_remarks: not quite clear to me if this is conspiracy or virus origin

Claim: “We’ve got to give the American public a rough estimate of how long we think this is going to take, based mostly on the South Korean model, which seems to be the trajectory that we are on, thankfully, and not the Italian model.”
Explaination: The U.S. and South Korea have similar case fatality rates – Italy’s is higher – but all three countries have age-specific mortality rates that are about the same. Public health experts say the fatality rate wouldn't be the only or the most important metric used to determine when businesses may reopen.The growth in cases and hospitals’ capacity to treat new patients is the most important factor.
Label: Half True
html:
Claim: “We’ve got to give the American public a rough estimate of how long we think this is going to take, based mostly on the South Korean model, which seems to be the trajectory that we are on, thankfully, and not the Italian model.”

Explanation:The U.S. and South Korea have similar case fatality rates – Italy’s is higher – but all three countries have age-specific mortality rates that are about the same. Public health experts say the fatality rate wouldn't be the only or the most important metric used to determine when businesses may reopen.The growth in cases and hospitals’ capacity to treat new patients is the most important factor.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/01/brian-fitzpatrick/pa-congressman-said-us-coronavirus-trajectory-more/

Claim: Chinese people rush to Japan to abuse Japanese health insurance system.
Explaination: According to Ministry of Health, this information is mostly false.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: Chinese people rush to Japan to abuse Japanese health insurance system.

Explanation:According to Ministry of Health, this information is mostly false.

https://www.buzzfeed.com/jp/saoriibuki/corona-virus-health-insurance

Claim: Italian police are being brutal on people not following lockdowns; India should follow.
Explaination: The police apprehended a man who was brandishing a gun in Sao Paulo, Brazil.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Italian police are being brutal on people not following lockdowns; India should follow.

Explanation:The police apprehended a man who was brandishing a gun in Sao Paulo, Brazil.

Claim: A video purports to show body bags for virus victims in Italy.
Explaination: It has previously circulated in media reports about people who died after contracting COVID-19 in Iran; a man recording the video can be heard stating that he is inside a mortuary in the Iranian city of Qom.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: A video purports to show body bags for virus victims in Italy.

Explanation:It has previously circulated in media reports about people who died after contracting COVID-19 in Iran; a man recording the video can be heard stating that he is inside a mortuary in the Iranian city of Qom.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-has-circulated-media-reports-about-coronavirus-deaths-iran

Claim: “The coronavirus was engineered by scientists in a lab.”
Explaination: There is no evidence that the coronavirus was created in a lab.
Label: False
html:
Claim: “The coronavirus was engineered by scientists in a lab.”

Explanation:There is no evidence that the coronavirus was created in a lab.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/feb/10/naturalnewscom/health-misinformation-site-promotes-conspiracy-abo/

Claim: “Coronavirus, nasa Pilipinas na (coronavirus, already in the Philippines)” – (Jan. 28)
Explaination: Kabisnes’s false and clickbait headline does not reflect its content. In the video’s first 10 seconds, the show host reads the phrase “Coronavirus, nasa Pilipinas na (coronavirus, already in the Philippines)” then proceeds to say that it was a claim circulating on social media, currently being debunked by Malacanang and DOH.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: “Coronavirus, nasa Pilipinas na (coronavirus, already in the Philippines)” – (Jan. 28)

Explanation:Kabisnes’s false and clickbait headline does not reflect its content. In the video’s first 10 seconds, the show host reads the phrase “Coronavirus, nasa Pilipinas na (coronavirus, already in the Philippines)” then proceeds to say that it was a claim circulating on social media, currently being debunked by Malacanang and DOH.

https://verafiles.org/articles/vera-files-fact-check-no-novel-coronavirus-ph-youtube-channe
ann23_remarks: wasn't clear what the claim is about

Claim: Says video shows “the Chinese are destroying the 5G poles as they are aware that it is the thing triggering the corona symptoms.”
Explaination: The video shows Hong Kong protesters tearing down “smart” lampposts because they feared they could be used to collect personal data from citizens.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Says video shows “the Chinese are destroying the 5G poles as they are aware that it is the thing triggering the corona symptoms.”

Explanation:The video shows Hong Kong protesters tearing down “smart” lampposts because they feared they could be used to collect personal data from citizens.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/07/viral-image/no-video-doesnt-show-people-china-destroying-5g-po/

Claim: A claim on Facebook that began to circulate around Wednesday, 3/25/20, says putting a peeled onion in any room can remove “all viruses and bacteria including coronavirus.”
Explaination: Putting peeled onions in a room will not prevent COVID-19 or a coronavirus infection, according to the National Onion Association (NOA) in the US. There are no official cures or vaccines for COVID-19, according to the World Health Organization (WHO) as of Tuesday, March 31, though there are cures and vaccines in testing.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A claim on Facebook that began to circulate around Wednesday, 3/25/20, says putting a peeled onion in any room can remove “all viruses and bacteria including coronavirus.”

Explanation:Putting peeled onions in a room will not prevent COVID-19 or a coronavirus infection, according to the National Onion Association (NOA) in the US. There are no official cures or vaccines for COVID-19, according to the World Health Organization (WHO) as of Tuesday, March 31, though there are cures and vaccines in testing.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/256547-onions-free-from-all-viruses-coronavirus

Claim: A claim that India’s Ministry of Home Affairs has made it a “punishable offense” for citizens to publish posts on social media about the novel coronavirus has been shared repeatedly on Facebook, Twitter and WhatsApp.
Explaination: The claim is false; India’s official Press Information Bureau said it had made no such law; an online search for the purported government minister who issued the alleged ban yielded no results.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A claim that India’s Ministry of Home Affairs has made it a “punishable offense” for citizens to publish posts on social media about the novel coronavirus has been shared repeatedly on Facebook, Twitter and WhatsApp.

Explanation:The claim is false; India’s official Press Information Bureau said it had made no such law; an online search for the purported government minister who issued the alleged ban yielded no results.

https://factcheck.afp.com/hoax-circulates-india-government-has-banned-coronavirus-related-posts-social-media

Claim: Coronavirus has gripped Italy and nobody is willing to carry corpses off Italy’s streets.
Explaination: The photo was taken on March 24, 2014 in Frankfurt, Germany. People lay down on a pedestrian area to remember victims who lost their lives in a Nazi concentration camp.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Coronavirus has gripped Italy and nobody is willing to carry corpses off Italy’s streets.

Explanation:The photo was taken on March 24, 2014 in Frankfurt, Germany. People lay down on a pedestrian area to remember victims who lost their lives in a Nazi concentration camp.

https://www.boomlive.in/fast-check/no-this-photo-does-not-show-dead-bodies-from-the-coronavirus-in-italy-7325

Claim: Indian government deploying the army in Telangana to curb the coronavirus situation
Explaination: The Telangana Commissioner refuted the claims, there are no plans to deploy army in the Indian state of Telangana.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Indian government deploying the army in Telangana to curb the coronavirus situation

Explanation:The Telangana Commissioner refuted the claims, there are no plans to deploy army in the Indian state of Telangana.

https://www.factcrescendo.com/fact-check-army-posting-at-telangana-due-to-coronavirus-outbreak/

Claim: President Trump claims the virus is under control and testing is available.
Explaination: The president spent nearly two months issuing confusing and contradictory signals — leaving the bureaucratic machine of the U.S. government to chart the course for the coronavirus response.
Label: False
html:
Claim: President Trump claims the virus is under control and testing is available.

Explanation:The president spent nearly two months issuing confusing and contradictory signals — leaving the bureaucratic machine of the U.S. government to chart the course for the coronavirus response.

https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2020/03/30/11-100000-what-went-wrong-with-coronavirus-testing-us/

Claim: President Uhuru Kenyatta of Kenya ordered credit reference bureaus to delist Kenyans who had defaulted on loans to protect Kenyans from the economic effects of COVID-19.
Explaination: President Kenyatta ordered the suspension of new listings for Kenyan citizens and businesses as one of the measures in response to COVID-19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: President Uhuru Kenyatta of Kenya ordered credit reference bureaus to delist Kenyans who had defaulted on loans to protect Kenyans from the economic effects of COVID-19.

Explanation:President Kenyatta ordered the suspension of new listings for Kenyan citizens and businesses as one of the measures in response to COVID-19.

https://pesacheck.org/false-president-kenyatta-has-not-ordered-credit-reference-bureaus-to-delist-kenyans-with-loan-32dc32e9360f?source=rss----ab41f21aa9a9---4

Claim: “59 people die as pastor gives them Dettol to drink in church to prevent coronavirus.”
Explaination: There’s no evidence 59 people died from drinking the cleaning product Dettol to prevent the coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: “59 people die as pastor gives them Dettol to drink in church to prevent coronavirus.”

Explanation:There’s no evidence 59 people died from drinking the cleaning product Dettol to prevent the coronavirus.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/08/viral-image/no-evidence-59-people-died-drinking-disinfectant-p/

Claim: Doctors in Japan advise people to drink water every 15 minutes to prevent an infection.
Explaination: WHO says drinking water does not prevent novel coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Doctors in Japan advise people to drink water every 15 minutes to prevent an infection.

Explanation:WHO says drinking water does not prevent novel coronavirus.

https://factcheck.afp.com/health-experts-say-drinking-water-every-15-minutes-does-not-prevent-coronavirus-infection
ann23_remarks: transmission isn't quite the same as prevention, but I think it's the nearest

Claim: Biden claims that Trump eliminated the White House pandemic office.
Explaination: One can see the dueling narratives here, neither entirely incorrect. The office — as set up by Obama — was folded into another office. Thus, one could claim the office was eliminated. But the staff slots did not disappear and at least initially the key mission of team remained a priority. So one can also claim nothing changed and thus Biden’s criticism is overstated.
Label: IN DISPUTE
html:
Claim: Biden claims that Trump eliminated the White House pandemic office.

Explanation:One can see the dueling narratives here, neither entirely incorrect. The office — as set up by Obama — was folded into another office. Thus, one could claim the office was eliminated. But the staff slots did not disappear and at least initially the key mission of team remained a priority. So one can also claim nothing changed and thus Biden’s criticism is overstated.

https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/2020/03/20/was-white-house-office-global-pandemics-eliminated/

Claim: Shoppers in China storm supermarket after coronavirus outbreak.
Explaination: The video has circulated in media reports since at least October 2019, two months before the viral outbreak was first reported.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Shoppers in China storm supermarket after coronavirus outbreak.

Explanation:The video has circulated in media reports since at least October 2019, two months before the viral outbreak was first reported.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-has-circulated-media-reports-least-october-2019-months-novel-coronavirus-outbreak

Claim: A post shared more than 165,000 times on Facebook includes a video of a woman turning a baby wipe into a face mask to “protect against coronavirus.”
Explaination: The company that sells the wipes says they should not be used in this way, and health experts also recommend caution.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: A post shared more than 165,000 times on Facebook includes a video of a woman turning a baby wipe into a face mask to “protect against coronavirus.”

Explanation:The company that sells the wipes says they should not be used in this way, and health experts also recommend caution.

https://factcheck.afp.com/wet-wipes-not-recommended-use-diy-coronavirus-protection-masks

Claim: Sick COVID-19 patients at the airport runway in Senegal.
Explaination: Video is old and not from Italy. It actually shows mock drill carried out on 28 November 2019 at Blaise Diagne Airport in Dakar, the capital of Senegal. It has nothing to do with coronavirus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Sick COVID-19 patients at the airport runway in Senegal.

Explanation:Video is old and not from Italy. It actually shows mock drill carried out on 28 November 2019 at Blaise Diagne Airport in Dakar, the capital of Senegal. It has nothing to do with coronavirus.

https://marathi.factcrescendo.com/old-video-of-mock-drill-at-senegal-airport-shared-as-from-italy-as-coronavirus-impact/

Claim: In Ecuador, Maritza Frías, former director of the Teófilo Dávila Hospital in Machala, and Mauro Calle, former manager of this health center, concealed official figures of those infected.
